Name: Statue of Rahotep
Description: This statue depicts Rahotep standing with his left foot forward. He wears a large wig reaching to his shoulders and a short kilt. His right hand rests on his chest, while his left arm falls by his side. He is holding kerchiefs. The statue is supported by a back pillar. The base of the pillar is engraved with the name and titles of the owner. The quality of the statue reveals the skill of the ancient sculptor who worked with hard stone. The sculptor succeeded in rendering the details of the face as well as the beautiful wig.
